etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in Miller's Dictionary Gardening. From classical Latin absinthium absinthium + -ine

definitions: An orange crystalline compound that is the chief bitter constituent of common wormwood, Artemisia absinthium.

notes.text: Absinthin is a polycyclic sesquiterpene lactone (it was formerly regarded as an alkaloid). Formula: C₃₀H₄₀O₆.
